did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Reminiscences of boyhood in Virginia during the Civil War; service with U.S. Army, chiefly at Ft. Huachuca and Ft. Stanton; cattle ranching in the San Pedro Valley, Ariz.; employment in Phoenix as a teamster; ministerial student at Randolph-Macon College, Ashland, Va.; and 39 years as a Methodist minister.

repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: William Bladen Jett Autobiography(AZ 312). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Bladen Jett was a Methodist minister and served with U.S. Army, 4th Cavalry in Ariz. and N.M.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This manuscript includes reminiscences of Jett's boyhood in Virginia during the Civil War; his service with the U.S. Army, chiefly at Ft. Huachuca and Ft. Stanton; cattle ranching in the San Pedro Valley, Ariz.; his employment in Phoenix as a teamster; his studies while a ministerial student at Randolph-Macon College, Ashland, Va.and 39 years serving as a Methodist minister until his retirement in 1929.

did.unittitle: Unpublished manuscript of William Bladen Jett's autobiography. 1938-1940
